Fellow Boomers:  IMMEDIATE ACTION REQUIRED

You may have also noticed this GROUPON.  There is only 4 days to purchase your $32 groupon  for a chance to attend a segway experience tour led by the Museum of Science.  If you've been wanting to do this, like me,  click the groupon link (below) , buy your groupon and our party of 6 will take the tour on September 17th.  We have until November to book this and while the weather is good, let's do this.  RSVP on meetup after you buy the groupon - the tour max is six.

http://www.groupon.com/deals/museum-of-science-boston?c=button&utm_content=all-deals_boston&date=20110902&division=boston&p=5&s=body&sid=10963278&utm_campaign=museum-of-science-boston&utm_medium=email&utm_source=newsletter&user=243ccff484eb63d0d1d664c8b499fa22fb0ae4773020a1471e501f29963320fd

Segway tours represent another step toward the inevitable fusion of man, machine, and commentary track. Give in to technological destiny with today’s Groupon to the Segway Experience at the  Museum of Science. Choose between two options:

  • For $32, you get one ticket to a Segway Experience (a $65 value).
  • For $59, you get two tickets to a Segway Experience (a $130 value).

The Museum of Science Segway Experience, powered by Segway of Boston, immerses tour-goers in the history of Cambridge for an hour as they glide through the picturesque city and listen via personal headset to trained guides. Guides are armed with iPads filled with maps and images that detail information about past events around the Charles River Basin. Before tours of up to six participants traverse sidewalks on a 60 minute tour, a guided 30-minute orientation teaches riders and steeds to coordinate turning, braking, and maintaining a steady pace during romantic strolls with long lost robot girlfriends. Tour-goers learn the natural and scientific history of the area, as well as summaries of local scientists’ research and key discoveries.
